description.narrative: The development intervention's intended outcome is to support the development of good rights-based environmental governance in Ukraine, with participation of society that is aware of environmental issues and challenges in Ukraine. It is also intended to ensure that there is in place a sound environmental policy of Ukraine developed in cooperation with key stakeholder groups which promotes approximation of Ukrainian environmental legislation to European legislation and thus brings Ukraine closer to European standards of environmental safety, principles of sustainable development and foundations of protecting human rights through protection of the environment. This outcome is to be achieved by providing core support to EPL in reaching its strategic goals.

Att ge tre års kärnstöd till en ledande ukrainsk civilsamhälleorganisation som förespråkar skydd av miljörättigheter och god miljöstyrning baserad på policyanalys, rådgivning och juridisk expertis.
Detta är en andra fas av kärnstöd till organisationen ICO Environment-People-Law.
Den första fasen av kärnstöd till ICO Environment-People-Law täckte perioden 01.08.2013 - 30.06.2017.

To provide three years of core support to a leading Ukrainian civil society organization advocating protection of environmental rights and good environmental governance based on policy analysis, counselling and legal expertise.
This is a second phase of core support for the organization ICO Environment-People-Law.
The first phase of core support for ICO Environment-People-Law covered the period from 01.01.2014 to 30.06.2017.

description.narrative: EPL is a long-term implementing partner of Sida and has been working under pre-core or core-support arrangements since 2013. In 2017 EPL drafted and approved a new Strategic Plan for 2017-2020 and established a detailed Results Assessment Framework (RAF). The Strategic Plan outlines EPL’s vision and mission statements and establishes an overall strategic goal for the organization: “Strengthened the rule of law for environmental protection”. In addition, EPL has defined three “components” or objectives: 1. Environmental justice and order for sustainable development and public health - The new system of environmental governance in Ukraine is established and enforced. 2. Amplifying the voice of EPL - Ensured effective communication among key stakeholders to achieve set objectives. 3. Management - Improved quality and efficiency of financial management, planning, organization, human resource development and communication Through the efforts of EPL during 2017-2020 the following goals have been achieved: 1. Ensured adequate access to justice for environmental protection in Ukraine. Ukraine's score of access to justice as of December 2020 is 1,87. In 2016 Score of Access to Justice in environmental matters within Environmental Democracy Index for Ukraine was 1,7 out of 3.0. Environmental Democracy Index for Ukraine, which includes the indicator for access to justice for environmental protection is a combination of several sub-components and is determined by expert analysis. 2. Ensured adequate public participation in environmental decision-making in Ukraine. Ukraine's score of public participation in environmental decision-making as of December 2020 is 2.0. In 2016 Score of Public Participation in environmental decision-making within Environmental Democracy Index for Ukraine was 0,69 out of 3.0. 3. Promoted environmental justice and order for sustainable development and public health. EPL has developed alternative draft law on the reform of environmental control and achieved registration of it in the Parliament. As of December 2020, EPL has developed 12 versions of the draft law on environmental control and currently is working on the 13th version. Totally, about 30 internal meetings of authors of the draft law took place and about 20 meetings held with external stakeholders to communicate key points of the reform of environmental control system. EPL provided comments to the draft anticorruption strategy of Ukraine for 2018-2020. Because of the change of political situation, the strategy was not adopted. EPL published Green Book and White Book on environmental control. EPL published Green Book and White Book on responsibility on the area of environmental protection. EPL developed 33 analytical documents on sectoral reform policies - forest management, waste management, animal protection etc. The National Strategy of Waste Management was adopted in November 2017. EPL provided 14 proposals to the strategy that were taken into account. EPL developed and submitted proposals to 22 regional programs of waste management. EPL contributed to the adoption of laws on EIA and SEA, based on EPL's proposals to these laws. EPL investigated and published data on dozens of corruption schemes in natural resources management. Importantly, in 2020 the State Audit Service of Ukraine published results of investigations initiated by EPL that proved EPL's investigation results received in 2018-2020. EPL contributed to strengthening the coalition of environmental CSOs in Ukraine by developing the guide for NGOs on strategic planning and institutional development, guide for CSOs on ways of public participation in decision-making process regarding waste management. EPL also assisted with registration of other CSOs, provided consultations to CSOs on EIA and SEA and other issues. In 2017-2018 EPL trained more than 100 judges on key aspects of environmental law and protection of environmental rights. In 2019, EPL did not hold trainings for judges but was a co-organizer of the forum for judges of Cassation Administrative Court in the Supreme Court attended by 60 judges. EPL has led 14 successful strategic litigation cases for protection of environmental rights and environment. 4. The voice of EPL has been amplified and the organization has ensured effective communication among key stakeholders to achieve set objectives. The important task here was to increase Ukrainians' environmental awareness and readiness to act to protect their environmental rights. According to the 2016 sociological survey, 2% of Ukrainians participated in environmental movements and 28% understood their importance and were ready to participate in environmental movements. According to the final sociological survey conducted by Ilko Kucheriv Democratic Initiatives Charitable Foundation, 9,4% of respondents actively use environmental information with the purpose to make some environmental change, 47,4 % of respondents find environmental issues most important. This has been supported by the organization through regular appearances in the media, including national TV, specialized trainings for journalists on environmental issues coverage, running specific information campaigns for critical issues, joint activities with local communities, raising competence and awareness of the authorities, businesses, working with social media, cooperating with academics and students. 5. Improved quality and efficiency of financial management, planning, organisation, human resource development and communication within the organisation itself by implementing the recommendations of the external system-based audit performed by NCG. EPL is assessed to have made significant and good progress implementing the recommendations from the Efficiency audit in 2017.
